statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Chris Fouch scored 27 points and Gerald Colds 14 to lift Drexel to a 63-58 victory over Northeastern in the opening game of the Boston Tip-Off Classic.
article.headline: Northeastern loses to Drexel at Boston Tip-Off
article.linkText: Northeastern loses to Drexel at Boston Tip-Off
article.story: BOSTON -- Chris Fouch scored 27 points and Gerald Colds 14 to lift Drexel to a 63-58 victory over Northeastern in the opening game of the Boston Tip-Off Classic on Saturday. Drexel (5-1, 1-0 Colonial Athletic Association) grabbed the lead midway into the first half and never trailed again. The Dragons, who opened a nine-point lead in the first half, led 33-31 at intermission. Chaisson Allen led the Huskies (2-4, 0-1) with 19 points and 10 rebounds. The game was tied three times in the second half, but the Huskies were never able to move in front. They closed it to one point six times in the final 20 minutes, the last at 52-51 on Jonathan Lee's layup with 9 1/2 minutes to play. Fouch followed with a layup and a 3-pointer to help the Dragons hold on.
